result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yiong Y Moua

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Yiong Y Moua appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy appeared by video for Yiong Y Moua.  Attorney Stephannie A Santelli Guzy appeared by video for Yiong Y Moua.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for February 2, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, and Elements, filed.

Defendant Yiong Y Moua appeared by video.  Attorney Stephannie A Santelli Guzy appeared by video for Yiong Y Moua.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Correction to entry made on 08/25/2022: Contact order to reflect no violent contact with SX and NBX.
Received and Filed. Defendant Letter to Court
Court modifies the no contact order to no violent contact with F.N.

Defendant Yiong Y Moua appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy and attorney Stephanie Guzy appeared by video for Yiong Y Moua.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Additional statement made by F.N. Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Victim requests bail modification as to the no contact order. No objections from the state. Court grants request. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case scheduled for a Bail Bond Hearing on 08/25/2022 at 08:30 AM, Br 29.

Prior: 1602 Kings Mill Way, #305, Madison, WI 53718

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SX, NBX.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Yiong Y Moua in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is re-assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
